column34: Please describe your experience interacting with the other participants in the study. What did you think about them? What was it like interacting with them? (Please write 2-3 sentences)
column35: What did you think about while taking part in the study? (Please write 2-3 sentences)

column34: I thought interacting with the other people was interesting.  I felt like we agreed on most issues but it was interesting to see some other conservatives opinions on issues.
column35: I thought that the study was well made and had an interesting layout.  I hope that I provided some interesting data to the research.
column36: I didn't notice anything strange.  I thought it might be about seeing if people's views changed when they know the views of other people.
column38: I think the questions were about my political opinions on certain issues.

column34: I thought it was OK| I didn't have much an impression of them. It was annoying sometimes that they didn't move faster. I didn't really think about their individual characteristics too much.
column35: I thought about some of the beliefs that others were expressing. Sometimes| their beliefs surprised me. I didn't think that some of their beliefs were consistent.
column38: I do not exactly recall| but I know they had to do with politics. They also might have had something to do with group unity or identity.

column34: It was very interesting too see what others chose on the issues. I thought we were all capable and mostly united in our decisions. It was great to see common ground on most issues.
column35: I really liked the issues that were chosen for participants. When I answered the issues| I took what others chose in consideration. This study seemed like a great forum to decide on issues.
column36: I thought the researchers were trying to determine how similar views on issues are among people with similar political ideals. No| I did not notice anything strange.
column37: Thank you! I enjoyed the study with no problems.
column38: The questions were about how the decisions of others affected my emotions. They also displayed how I felt about the other participants during the study.

column34: I enjoyed it.  It was interesting to see what other people had to say.
column35: I did not want anyone waiting on me.  I read the question as soon as it came up.

column34: I really enjoyed participating in this project.  I would like to do more of these online panels in the future.
column35: I was reminded of being in a classroom setting.  It was like participating in a political debate with my peers.
column36: I believe the study centered on how conservatives disagree and agree on certain issues.
column37: Thank you for giving me the opportunity to participate in this study.

column34: I was great! I enjoyed being able to interact with other conservative Mturkers. It is interesting to know how close fellow conservatives are on the issues that this country is facing.
column35: How We better get a republican president this year or this country will be sailed down the river| rights and civil liberties will be taken away by the likes of people like Hillary Clinton.
column36: Perceptions of people who are conservative. i did not notice anything strange.
column38: Don't remember for sure. they were about how liberal or conservative my ideals were on different topics.

column34: Player B was a bit sluggish. Was not really surprised boy anyone's answers as we were all supposedly conservatives. It really didn't feel like interaction between humans but it was.
column35: I was thinking about being on top of the situation| answering promptly and not making my fellow turkers wait for my reply (like Player B did).
column36: I thought the study was to engage and measure conservatives. Observing everyone's collection opinions on various current topics?
column37: Obviously Obama care is not very popular! Thanks for letting me participate. It was fun.
column38: Was it something with questions asking my political attitudes on various topics| such as health care| immigration| etc? I really don't remember too well| but I do enjoy taking studies with political questions.

column34: I enjoyed it and thought it interesting to see how each people felt about each issue.  As the questions went along I felt like I got another piece of the puzzle to get a more clear picture of who that person is.
column35: I was thinking about my own beliefs and answering honestly.  I was thinking about the other participants answers and trying to get an idea of what that person is like.
column36: I think the study was not only trying to see how each individual felt about political issues| but also trying to see if people would answer the questions about issues similar to the other participants.  For example if three people said strongly oppose an issue you might expect there to be a high correlation with the 4th person answering strongly oppose or somewhat near that.
column37: Thank you for offering this study.  It was enjoyable!
column38: Questions about my positions on political issues.  Questions about how I view myself and certain personality traits that I'm currently feeling.
